meanings.definition: To walk with short steps, swaying from side to side
meanings.sent1: The duck was waddling across the pond.
meanings.sent2: The penguin was waddling on the ice.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried waddling like a penguin, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The elderly man was waddling slowly, like a penguin on land.
meanings.sent5: The waddling of the duck was a comical sight.

meanings.definition: The act of moving with short steps, swaying from side to side
meanings.sent1: The waddling of the duck caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The penguin's waddling was adorable to watch.
meanings.sent3: The waddling of the toddler resembled a little dance.
meanings.sent4: The waddling of the elderly man was a reminder of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The waddling of the ducklings was a charming scene in the park.
